intro: Stickmannia alba, commonly known as the white stickman plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions. Stickmannia alba is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
